item.title: Roblox: Ro Ghoul Codes (May 2025)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Ro Ghoul Codes
  • How to Redeem Codes in Ro Ghoul
  • Ro Ghoul Tips and Tricks
  • The Best Roblox Anime Games Like Ro Ghoul
  • About the Ro Ghoul Developer

In Ro Ghoul , Roblox players will plunge into the world of Ghouls and strong evolved creatures, where the main task will be survival. They can also experience the game as a hunter or prey. This article offers Roblox players all the latest Ro Ghoul codes, which they can use to increase their chances of survival in this cruel world.

Updated May 3, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: Ro Ghoul continues to offer a solid lineup of codes that can help boost your in-game progress. You can use them to pick up resources like RC, Yen, or Color Credits, depending on what you need most. These bonuses are especially helpful if you're aiming to upgrade or customize your character. The code list can be changed any time, so it’s worth checking back in case new ones are added.

Ro Ghoul Codes

This game was created quite a while ago, and the developers are still updating it and adding active codes. Hurry up and redeem all active codes before they become inactive. This article is constantly updated, so players can keep updated with the latest new codes.

Codes Checked on May 3 , 2025.

Working Ro Ghoul Codes

How to Redeem Codes in Ro Ghoul

Redeeming codes in Ro Ghoul is different from other Roblox games, but it is still not a difficult process. Players just need to follow the instructions below:

  • Open Roblox and launch Ro Ghoul .
  • Paste the code to The Chat window. It can be opened by using the "/" key on the keyboard or by clicking the speech bubble symbol in the top-left corner of the screen.
  • Write or paste the code in the following field.
  • Press “Enter.”

Ro Ghoul Tips and Tricks

Below are some tips and tricks to play Ro Ghoul :

  • Use trainers to level up and upgrade stats quickly.
  • Farm near the cafe to avoid enemy attacks.
  • Complete tasks for reputation points to earn more Yen.
  • Activate shift lock mode in settings and press shift for better combat.

The Best Roblox Anime Games Like Ro Ghoul

Anime is very popular in general, and anime Roblox games are no exception. This genre offers a lot of variety, so if players are looking for alternatives to this game, there are plenty of viable options. To help out, below is a list of the best Roblox games like Ro Ghoul :

  • Rogue Demon
  • Anime Adventures
  • A One Piece Game
  • Project Mugetsu
  • Project Slayers

About the Ro Ghoul Developer

Ro Ghoul was created by SushiWalrus on July 12, 2017. For a long time, he has been actively updating the game, but unfortunately, this is his only popular game.

item.title: Monster Hunter Wilds: Where to Find Sparkly Treasure
item.description:
Sparkly Treasures are one of the rare trade items players can get in Monster Hunter Wilds . The gathering points where these items can be found are relatively plenty, but the odds of actually getting a Sparkly Treasure are fairly low, so expect to do a lot of gathering over a long period of time.

If you plan on getting items for bartering in MH Wilds , you'll need both luck and patience. Thankfully, there's a way to increase your chances of getting Sparkly Treasures — there's a right time and place for treasure hunting, and if you're wondering how you can get as many Sparkly Treasures as possible, here's a quick guide to help you out.

MH Wilds: Sparkly Treasure Location

Sparkly Treasures are found in the Scarlet Forest . Specifically, they're rare drops from Weathered Treasure gathering points. These are often found underwater and in ancient ruins, and if you're unsure where to find these gathering points, you can use the Filters feature on your map to pinpoint their exact locations.

To use the Filters feature, open your map and press the Left or Right D-pad keys (or A/D if you're using mouse and keyboard). This will open up a list of all the things in your current area, including all sorts of gathering points, different types of Slinger ammo, and all the monsters present at that time.

The best place to look for Sparkly Treasure is the underground lake behind the waterfall near the Wudwud Hideout. Dive into the water and look around for Weathered Treasure points.

Best Time and Environment Condition

To maximize the amount of Weathered Treasure gathering points in the Scarlet Forest, check the Environment Overview tab in your map and see if there's an upcoming Weathered Treasure Upsurge event on the timeline.

Such events happen in other maps (as is the case with Genesis Opals), and in the Scarlet Forest, you can usually experience Weathered Treasure Upsurges close to Nighttime during Season of Plenty . It may take upwards of 10 or 20 minutes before an Upsurge starts, and in those cases, you have no choice but to wait.

Again, Sparkly Treasures are very rare, and you'll likely get Shiny Treasures when you interact with Weathered Treasure gathering points.

Fishing

You can also get Sparkly Treasure by catching Gastronome Tuna. Get some Tuff Joint Bait, then head to any deep fishing spot in Area 17. There's a chance that you'll get some Sparkly Treasure (among other things) after catching a Gastronome Tuna.

Material Retrieval

Once you unlock Plumpeach as a Material Retrieval NPC, you can ask them to gather stuff for you as you go do other things. If you set Plumpeach's gathering target to random items, there's a chance for them to get some Sparkly Treasures for you.

10 Images
10 Images

item.title: Emptiness Sire's Three Heroes and Gameplay Explained
item.description:
Isometric turn-based puzzle game Emptiness Sire takes players to a world transformed by a mysterious meteor shower that left strange and potentially dangerous Fragments scattered everywhere. Now, in a world permanently altered by the Fragments and their powers, three heroes take up three very different weapons to challenge the enemies preventing them from rebuilding and living peacefully. From Brazil-based developer Oaks Games Studio and presented by Abragames at Gamescom LATAM 2025, Emptiness Sire challenges players to take on cosmically powerful foes by utilizing each of its three classes in tandem.

Emptiness Sire is inspired by games that successfully blend puzzles, isometric design, and turn-based combat, such as Hitman Go and Lara Croft Go. The world is a dark and forbidding one inspired by the cosmic horror of HP Lovecraft, while the art style blends darker backgrounds with brightly colored characters in a manner similar to Hades. But no matter how dark, frightening or powerful the enemies become, players can face them down using a combination of all three characters, switching between them and making use of their unique abilities in battle. Successfully completing each of Emptiness Sire's puzzles requires knowing when to deploy each character and when to switch out for another.

The Knight: A Dreamer With A Sword

The first of Emptiness Sire's three classes is the Knight, a hero who hails from a small village hidden within an ancient forest. Raised on relics, stories, and tradition, the Knight dreams of the world as it once was before the coming of the Fragments. But he wants more than to simply listen to the stories - he wants to help restore the world to the way it used to be.

After the Knight's village was attacked, he took up the ancestral sword of his people and set out on a journey, becoming a symbol of hope to those around him. A melee-focused damage dealer, the Knight uses his sword to attack enemies directly in front of him for large amounts of damage.

The Explorer: A Survivor With A Flute

Unlike the Knight, who grew up surrounded by community, the Explorer is an isolated master of survival born among a group of people sheltering deep within a cave system. Growing up in hostile territory and constantly forced to fight to survive, the Explorer quickly became a solitary and wary figure who sensed danger around every corner.

However, as she explored the world around her and dug more deeply into the mystery of the past world, the Explorer discovered a long-forgotten art: music. One day, she discovered a flute that, when played, was capable of sending even the most powerful monsters to sleep. Wielding her flute in battle, the Explorer is an agile character who can move around the isometric battlefield and utilize the power of music to stop enemies in their tracks.

The Guardian: A Protector With A Gauntlet

The third playable character, the Guardian, comes from a society dedicated to excavating and restoring objects left behind from advanced ancient civilization. Rather than succumbing to the change brought on by the Fragments, her people worked to restore what had been lost, and successfully created many objects usable in battle, including the sacred gauntlet that the Guardian herself wields.

To become a Guardian, she sacrificed her dominant arm and replaced it with the gauntlet. In battle, she can use the gauntlet to create a protective shield around herself, deflecting the attacks of her enemies. She can also leave these shields behind to protect the other characters when she is switched out. An intimidating figure in full-body armor, selecting the Guardian allows Emptiness Sire players to defend against even the most powerful of foes.

item.title: The Story of Indiana Jones and the Great Circle in 5 Minutes - Bite-Size Lore
item.description: The great circle uses its video game format to globetrot around iconic destinations, from the Catholic archives in the Vatican, to the pyramids of Egypt, all the way to the very tip of Mount Everest, it's an adventure that will take you anywhere and everywhere. So today on Game Rant let's break down the whole story of Indiana Jones and the great circle in 5 minutes or less.

item.title: The True Meaning of Flowers in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 Explained
item.description:
The following contains spoilers for Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 .

Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 has proven to be one of the most artistic games in recent memory, with an art style and themes that are as captivating as its story and music. One of Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 's core themes and artistic expressions happens to be flowers, though not merely on account of their beauty and therefore the breathtaking imagery they often contribute to. From the prologue to the game's last breath, flowers are a core aspect of Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 's imagery, and that's all due to what they represent both symbolically and narratively.

During the game's prologue, players are tasked with meeting up with Sophie as Gustave, who is wearing a wreath of flowers around her neck to indicate that she is about to Gommage — Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 's tragedy that is central to its narrative. Once the Gommage occurs, Sophie fades away into flowers, along with a vast number of other people within Lumiere. From then on, flowers are a constant motif that Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 uses to convey the frailty and beauty of death, as well as one of the story's biggest revelations.

What Flowers Really Mean in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33

Flowers Represent the Frailty and Beauty of Life and Death

Flowers are often used in literature and other media to convey the beauty and frailty of life and death. In essence, flowers bloom brightly but briefly, making them a perfect metaphor for the fleeting nature of life, youth, and beauty. Ultimately, they serve as a reminder that life, like a flower, is delicate and temporary. With the frailty and beauty of life and death being at the center of the game's primary themes, this is a major reason why flowers are regularly shown during Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 's story.

Flowers are a constant motif that Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 uses to convey the frailty and beauty of death, as well as one of the story's biggest revelations.

A flower's life — from bud to bloom to wilt — is a reflection of the human journey from birth to maturity to death. This makes flowers natural symbols for both celebrations (weddings, births) and times of mourning (funerals, memorials). A bride walking down the aisle to meet her husband is often carrying a bouquet of flowers that she later tosses into the air for one of her bridesmaids to catch as a symbol of who will be next in line to get married. On the contrary, flowers are often brought to someone's grave or funeral as a way to remember and honor their life. Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 often uses flowers in this way — to symbolize when someone has passed.

Flowers Manifest in Clair Obscur's World on Account of Verso's Death

Flowers aren't just included in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 as a symbol, however, and are instead directly linked to one of the story's biggest reveals. As it turns out, Lumiere and the rest of the world in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 is an artifical world created by the Paintress herself in order to preserve her son's memory. In the real world, a group of people known as "Painters" exist who can bring entire worlds to life by painting them on a canvas. After her son, Verso, was claimed by a tragic fire, Aline Dessendre (the Paintress) used his canvas to bring him back to life and preserve his memory, despite it only being an artificial reflection of the true Verso.

There is also another group in Clair Obscur 's real world called the "Writers," who the Painters are apparently in constant conflict with.

In a sense, then, the canvas Aline used to revive Verso's memory serves as his casket, which is witnessed during Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 's "good" ending. Should players choose to end the story by destroying the canvas, they will witness the Dessendre family standing before Verso's grave, which is covered in flowers. In other words, flowers are such a constant theme in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 because they symbolize a grieving mother's memory of her son, which has inadvertently found its way into the canvas as she remains in denial about his death.

10 Images
10 Images
